com.ikanow.aleph2.data_model.interfaces.shared_services

Interface IDataWriteService<O>

  • Type Parameters:
    O -
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ICrudService<O>, ICrudService.IReadOnlyCrudService<O>, IManagementCrudService<O>, IManagementCrudService.IReadOnlyManagementCrudService<O>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CrudServiceUtils.ReadOnlyCrudService, CrudServiceUtils.ReadOnlyManagementCrudService

    public interface IDataWriteService<O>
    A write only object store - no concept of deduplication, querying, updates etc - then is extended by ICrudService to provide the full functionality
    Author:
    Alex

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  IDataWriteService.IBatchSubservice<O>
      A more efficient batch interface that may or may not be implemented

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CompletableFuture<Long> countObjects()
      Counts the number of objects in the data store
      CompletableFuture<Boolean> deleteDatastore()
      Deletes the entire datastore and all documents, including mappings/indexes/metdata etc
      default Optional<IDataWriteService.IBatchSubservice<O>> getBatchWriteSubservice()
      Retrieves a batch write subservice if one exists
      Optional<ICrudService<O>> getCrudService()
      If this is an underlying CRUD service (Eg a database not a file store), then the underlying technology can be retrieved from this method
      IDataWriteService<com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode> getRawService()
      Returns an identical version of this CRUD service but using JsonNode instead of beans (which may save serialization)
      <T> Optional<T> getUnderlyingPlatformDriver(Class<T> driver_class, Optional<String> driver_options)
      USE WITH CARE: this returns the driver to the underlying technology shouldn't be used unless absolutely necessary!
      CompletableFuture<Supplier<Object>> storeObject(O new_object)
      Stores the specified object in the database, failing if it is already present If the "_id" field of the object is not set then it is assigned
      CompletableFuture<scala.Tuple2<Supplier<List<Object>>,Supplier<Long>>> storeObjects(List<O> new_objects) 

    • Method Detail

      • storeObject

        CompletableFuture<Supplier<Object>> storeObject(O new_object)
        Stores the specified object in the database, failing if it is already present If the "_id" field of the object is not set then it is assigned
        Parameters:
        new_object -
        Returns:
        A future containing the _id (filled in if not present in the object) - accessing the future will also report on errors via ExecutionException

      • storeObjects

        CompletableFuture<scala.Tuple2<Supplier<List<Object>>,Supplier<Long>>> storeObjects(List<O> new_objects)
        Parameters:
        objects - - a list of objects to insert, not handling duplicates
        Returns:
        A future containing the list of _ids (filled in if not present in the object), and the number of docs retrieved - accessing the future will also report on errors via ExecutionException

      • countObjects

        CompletableFuture<Long> countObjects()
        Counts the number of objects in the data store
        Parameters:
        spec - A specification generated by CrudUtils.allOf(...) (all fields must be match) or CrudUtils.anyOf(...) (any fields must match) together with extra fields generated by .withAny(..), .withAll(..), present(...) or notPresent(...)
        Returns:
        A future containing the number of matching objects - accessing the future will also report on errors via ExecutionException

      • deleteDatastore

        CompletableFuture<Boolean> deleteDatastore()
        Deletes the entire datastore and all documents, including mappings/indexes/metdata etc
        Returns:
        a future describing if the delete was successful - accessing the future will also report on errors via ExecutionException

      • getBatchWriteSubservice

        default Optional<IDataWriteService.IBatchSubservice<O>> getBatchWriteSubservice()
        Retrieves a batch write subservice if one exists
        Returns:
        the batch write subservice

      • getCrudService

        Optional<ICrudService<O>> getCrudService()
        If this is an underlying CRUD service (Eg a database not a file store), then the underlying technology can be retrieved from this method
        Returns:
        the full CRUD service, if it exists

      • getRawService

        IDataWriteService<com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode> getRawService()
        Returns an identical version of this CRUD service but using JsonNode instead of beans (which may save serialization)
        Returns:
        the JsonNode-genericized version of this same CRUD service

      • getUnderlyingPlatformDriver

        <T> Optional<T> getUnderlyingPlatformDriver(Class<T> driver_class,
                                            Optional<String> driver_options)
        USE WITH CARE: this returns the driver to the underlying technology shouldn't be used unless absolutely necessary!
        Parameters:
        driver_class - the class of the driver
        a - string containing options in some technology-specific format
        Returns:
        a driver to the underlying technology. Will exception if you pick the wrong one!
